Title:
Yeast diversity in the traditional Mexican alcoholic beverage
pulque, with description of three new yeast species: Starmerella
elongatum sp. nov., Kazachstania paragamospora sp. nov., and Pichia
mexicensis sp. nov.
Keywords:
Pulque; New yeast species, Starmerella elongatum sp. nov.;
Kazachstania paragamospora sp. nov.; Pichia mexicensis sp. nov.
Abstract:
During a survey of yeasts associated with the traditional
Mexican alcoholic beverage pulque in Central Mexico, 41 yeast strains
were isolated from six Pulque samples collected from two different
production locations in Mexico. Among the yeasts isolated in this study,
31 strains were identified as 9 known species in the class Ascomycota
(20/31) or Basidiomycota (11/31). The remaining 10 strains were found to
represent three novel species in three clades of the class Ascomycota
based on morphological and phylogenetic analyses (ITS and nuc 28S),
three new species are proposed: Starmerella elongatum, Kazachstania
paragamospora and Pichia mexicensis. Descriptions of these novel yeast
species are provided along with discussion of their ecology in relation
to the fermentation of pulque and their biochemical roles in this
process.
